page.title: 11STREETS AND BUILDINGS ix.
page.content: Station Rd. Station Road was once the principal route to the South,but the construction A45 road made it a cul-de-sac.Built on this road was the railway station (now a Restaurant), the river wharves, and one of the three water mills in the parish(whose name-White Mill-survives in the nearby Garden Centre.) The built up section of the road contains a small bakery and shop, and two grocers.Otherwise the street is made up of mixed private and council accommodation apart from the premises of the largest local employer,Messrs Barker. A large traditional shoe factory has been extended to its limits and a controversial new site is being developed at the Northern end of Station Rd on an area stretching through to West St.and Park St.
